items.title: KKR-backed Serentica to buy Statkraft's solar power business
items.summary:
- **Serentica Renewables**, backed by **KKR**, will acquire Statkraft's India solar business for an enterprise value of about **$220-250 million**. 
- It **outbid rival Blackstone** and a formal announcement is expected within days. 
- The deal adds roughly **1.5 GW** of solar capacity (plus hydropower assets) to Serentica's portfolio.

items.title: Tata Technologies buys German company ESTEC for ₹750 cr
items.author: Shally Mohile, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Tata Technologies to acquire Germany's ESTEC for ₹750 crore to bolster its *software-defined vehicle* capabilities and establish a Europe base.
- ESTEC's 300-strong team brings *ADAS* and comfort electronics expertise, complementing Tata Tech's strengths in infotainment and e-powertrains, with the deal expected to be accretive to profitability and EPS from day one.
- The acquisition expands Tata Tech's European strategy, with plans to grow teams in Germany, Morocco and India, while avoiding *headcount rationalisation* and pursuing further strategic targets.

items.title: IDTA fund to boost semiconductors and AI infra
items.author: Suraksha P, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- IDTA, launched at Semicon India 2025 with a $1B commitment, is expected to channel a substantial share to *semiconductors* and *AI infrastructure*.
- Sriram Viswanathan of *Celesta Capital* says private capital will be crucial for de-risking, helping fabless chip design, and enabling cross-border partnerships and global customer access.
- India’s policy tailwinds from the **India Semiconductor Mission (ISM)** and incentives are meant to spur domestic demand, manufacturing, and ecosystem development for semiconductors and AI data centers.

items.title: China crude steel output falls for third month on curbs
items.summary:
- August crude steel output was *77.37 million tons*, down 0.7% YoY and 2.9% from July.
- Average daily output in August was *2.5 million tons*, vs *2.57 in July*, as Tangshan and other plants constrained for cleaner air.
- Eight-month total reached *671.81 million tons*, down 2.8% YoY amid demand slowdown and curbs.

items.title: Apple deepens ties to Kentucky plant for iPhone glass
items.summary:
- **Apple** and **Corning** will shift production at the *Harrodsburg* plant to supply 100% of the iPhone and Apple Watch cover glass. 
- **Apple** has committed about **$2.5 billion** to expand capacity, create up to 500 jobs, and open an innovation center at the site. 
- By the end of 2026, all cover glass for the iPhone and Apple Watch will be manufactured in Kentucky.

items.title: China probes US semiconductors ahead of Madrid talks
items.summary:
- China launched two probes targeting the **US semiconductor sector** ahead of Madrid talks on trade and security, including an anti-dumping review of analog ICs and gate-driver chips from the US.
- The ministry also opened an anti-discrimination probe into US measures against China's chip sector.
- In Madrid, US officials and Chinese counterparts discuss de-risking strategic industries like **semiconductors** amid export curbs and an expanded **entity list** of Chinese firms.

items.title: India’s IT eyes chip-electronics foray
items.summary:
- *India’s top IT firms* are diversifying into electronics and semiconductors, *leveraging engineering and R&D strength* to glide past growth bumps.
- They are pursuing acquisitions and partnerships across the *semiconductor value chain*—design, OSAT, and wafer fabs—to de-risk dependence on imports.
- Industry leaders say bold bets and policy support could make India a *global hub for semiconductor design and manufacturing* in the long term.

items.title: Titagarh launches third DSC for Indian Navy
items.summary:
- Titagarh Rail Systems launched the third **Diving Support Craft (DSC)** for the Indian Navy, under the *Make in India* initiative.
- The DSCs are catamaran-type vessels to support the Navy's *Command Clearance Diving Teams* in underwater repair, maintenance and salvage, and will also serve as training platforms.
- Umesh Chowdhary, MD of TRSL, says the project strengthens *indigenous naval capabilities* and *defence manufacturing*, reinforcing Titagarh's role in India's maritime build.

items.title: Kerala gets ₹100 cr food & life-sciences hub at Angamaly
items.summary:
- **RCC Nutrafill**'s **Angamaly facility** is a Rs 100-crore hub blending food processing with life sciences to spur a local industrial ecosystem.
- Spread over five acres and slated for completion in 24 months, it will house cold storage, warehousing, R&D, logistics, and create about 500 jobs.
- The project underlines Kerala's commitment to innovation-led growth with government support to set a benchmark in sustainable manufacturing.

items.title: Airbus, Thales, Leonardo eye satellite tie-up
items.summary:
- *Airbus Defence and Space* chief *Michael Schoellhorn* says *Leonardo*, *Thales*, and *Airbus* could sign an initial satellite-tie-up this year.
- The plan uses a two-step process: a framework agreement, then a closing, with signing possibly as early as 2025.
- The initiative, called **Project Bromo**, would create a satellite-manufacturing firm to compete with **Starlink**.

items.title: The next leap: How India is building sovereign smart manufacturing
items.summary:
- *India's Edge-first strategy* uses local *Edge MES* and *SLMs* to keep data sovereign with low latency while staying connected to global supply chains.
- The government serves as an infrastructure builder, establishing standards and open networks like **ONDC for Manufacturing** and promoting state-level specialization.
- The plan aims to attract talent, cut costs and latency, and shift global manufacturing terms toward Indian data sovereignty.

items.title: How private players are driving India’s defence manufacturing boom
items.author: Paras Nath
items.summary:
- Private Indian firms are ramping up *defence manufacturing*, leveraging R&D and reverse‑engineering to modernise ageing platforms beyond the PSU era. 
- Government moves like *DAP 2020*, *Production Linked Incentive (PLI)* schemes and the *Defence Industrial Corridors* in UP and Tamil Nadu are boosting private‑public collaboration and easing licensing for startups and legacy players. 
- This private‑public synergy, aligned with *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, could position India as a future global defence exporter and reshape the strategic landscape.

items.title: GST not on post-sale dealer discounts: CBIC clarifies
items.summary:
- Post-sale discounts from manufacturers to dealers for competitive pricing are *not subject to GST*.
- GST applies only when a dealer provides promotional services (e.g., advertising, co-branding) under a defined agreement.
- *CBIC* clarifies the distinction between *trade discounts* and separate services, reducing disputes and boosting certainty for businesses.

items.title: Defence sec calls for industry-R&D-academia synergy
items.summary: - *STRIDE 2025* spotlighted deeper industry–R&D–academia collaboration to strengthen India’s indigenous defence ecosystem.\n- He warned of turbulent geopolitics and urged building hard power with *AI*, *quantum-secure communications*, *drones*, and resilient cyber infrastructure, emphasizing the private sector’s role.\n- The seminar highlighted reforms, DRDO’s catalytic role, and a Whole-of-Nation approach to scale defence manufacturing for a self-reliant *Bharat*.

items.title: Industry seeks PLI to boost agrochemicals & cut imports
items.summary:
- ACFI urges a **PLI scheme** and tax holidays to cut *import dependence* for key inputs and to build domestic agrochemical hubs.
- The Deloitte report highlights India as a major exporter (about USD **3.3B** in 2024-25) and warns of supply shocks from imports.
- Calls for stronger *Public-Private R&D* and MSME support to ease doing business and boost local production.

items.title: Godrej Aerospace bags 5-year Safran contract to supply LEAP engine components
"Electronics that go into defence will have dual use": Defence Secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh
Haryana eyes ₹5,000 crore investment in medical device manufacturing
Shree Refrigerations aims for top-3 in data centre cooling
items.summary:
- SRL signs MoU with Smardt Chillers to bring **magnetic-bearing** cooling tech for data-centre environments.
- The shift from defence to data centres targets energy savings (20–40% in part-load) and a data‑centre revenue share of about 10–15%, with naval orders still dominant.
- SRL aims to be among the top-3 players in India's data centre cooling market within five years, leveraging its naval legacy and new technology.

items.title: Industry optimistic about growth in auto parts exports despite tariffs
items.summary:
- *India's $80B auto components industry* faces a limited long-term impact from US/Mexico tariffs due to relatively low exposure, with exports of about $6.6B to the US and $0.5B to Mexico.
- Industry leaders expect a rebound driven by India's *cost edge* and a shift toward resilient supply chains, with opportunities in **wiring harnesses** and **ICE powertrain parts**.
- *Multi-sourcing* and a potential **EU FTA** could spur growth, but tariffed parts and geopolitical uncertainty keep decision-making cautious.

items.title: Govt likely to pick 7 AI startups for IndiaAI incentives
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The government is likely to shortlist Avataar.ai, Tech Mahindra, Fractal Analytics, Genloop, IntelliHealth, Shodha AI and Zenteiq Aitech Innovations for incentives under the **IndiaAI Mission**.
- **BharatGen** is also among the shortlisted firms, with final beneficiaries expected to be announced soon by the electronics and IT ministry.
- The **IndiaAI incentives** program has drawn hundreds of applications since January, with ₹1,500 crore allocated to fund AI models, including large reasoning models.

items.title: Delta Electronics expands Krishnagiri capacity
items.summary:
- Delta Electronics India is expanding its *Krishnagiri facility* with two new factories to meet demand from *EV makers* and industrial clients.
- Headcount at Krishnagiri will rise from 3,750 to about 5,000 in three years, with a target to capture up to *40%* of India’s EV market.
- The expansion aligns with **Make in India** and Tamil Nadu's growth push, including vendor development and a 6,000‑bed employee housing complex.

items.title: FMCG companies may get a volume boost from GST cut
items.author: Sagar Malviya, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- GST cuts could boost *volume growth* rather than revenue, since prices have remained largely stable and demand supports volume-based purchases.
- Price-point packs dominate several categories, with the ₹20 pack up 27% in volume share and higher grammage options likely to spur further consumption.
- **Kotak Institutional Equities** warns of a likely low impact on volumes and modest profitability, with effects unfolding as shoppers adjust and stock clears.

items.title: NPPA directs GST rate cut pass-through to consumers
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The **GST rate cut** shall be *passed on* to consumers for drugs and medical devices, effective Sept 22, 2025. 
- Manufacturers must issue revised MRPs and price lists to dealers and state authorities and *sensitize* retailers and consumers through multiple channels. 
- The 56th GST Council recommended moving major drugs from **5%** to **nil**, while medicines previously taxed at 12% were not shifted to 5%.

items.title: Patrushev to visit India to boost fertiliser exports
items.author: Dipanjan Roy Chaudhury, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Russia's Deputy PM **Dmitry Patrushev** plans a New Delhi visit to discuss boosting **fertiliser exports** to India and **importing shrimps** from India.
- The report notes a push to strengthen bilateral ties, including a **bilateral strategy** for agri-exports and seafood trade, with India as a key partner for **Russia**.
- It also highlights that India's shrimp exports face U.S. tariffs, suggesting Russia could offer an alternative market for **Indian shrimp exporters**.

items.title: Batteries in Indian conditions: challenges and opportunities
items.summary:
- India is a stress test: batteries must withstand *heat*, *dust*, *moisture*, and *erratic power*, not just lab specs.
- Liquid cooling and a smarter *BMS* are essential to prevent hotspots, detect abuse, and support fast charging.
- Field data and an *India-first design* deliver higher *reliability*, easier *repairability*, and better end-of-life recycling.

items.title: Karkhana.io expands into EMS; aims ₹200cr revenue
items.author: Nisha Shukla
items.summary:
- **Karkhana.io** has shifted to an integrated EMS, aiming to double revenue to ₹200 crore in 12 months.
- In-house SMT, assembly, testing and tighter *NPI* to improve time-to-market and margins.
- Plans **₹20–30 crore** capex and expansion into the US/EU, moving toward ODM and platform-driven solutions.

items.title: India, EU eye win-win FTA at ACMA
items.summary:
- *Piyush Goyal* and *Maros Sefcovic* push for a fair, balanced FTA with talks aimed to finish by December.
- They expect a **win-win** deal that boosts two-way trade, automotive tech, and *innovation* between India and the EU.
- The discussion covers auto duty concessions, stronger supply chains, and cooperation on cleaner technologies amid geopolitical volatility.

items.title: GE Vernova to sell Proficy unit to TPG for $600M
items.summary:
- *GE Vernova* to sell the Proficy industrial software unit to *TPG* for $600M, reinvesting the proceeds in grid software. 
- Proficy accounts for about 20% of Vernova's electrification software revenue, with the deal likely to close in H1 2026 and TPG owning Proficy while GE keeps a board observer seat. 
- The move follows cost pressures and a $600M U.S. factory upgrade, signaling a shift toward core manufacturing and grid software.

items.title: ACME Solar secures SBI funding for renewable energy project
items.summary:
- ACME Solar Holdings secured INR 3,892 crore in long-term funding from *SBI* for a **400 MW** *FDRE* project in *Barmer, Rajasthan*. 
- The project includes a *Battery Energy Storage System (BESS)* and is contracted with *NHPC* at INR 4.64 per unit to ensure dispatchability. 
- This marks SBI’s first financing in ACME’s FDRE portfolio and the largest bank funding ACME has received from *SBI*, with repayments spread over 19 years.

items.title: Ascent Circuits to set up PCB fab in Tamil Nadu
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
*Ascent Circuits* Private Limited, part of Amber Group, will invest ₹1,100 crore to establish a PCB manufacturing facility in *Hosur*, *Tamil Nadu*, aiming to become India's largest-volume PCB plant.  
It is the first PCB project in India to be recognised under the central government's Electronics Components Manufacturing Scheme (**ECMS**).  
The project is expected to reduce import dependence, create employment, and strengthen domestic electronics under the **Atmanirbhar Bharat** initiative.

items.title: GE Aerospace & Safran ink Godrej LEAP components deal
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Godrej Enterprises Group will manufacture titanium ventilation assemblies for the **LEAP** engines, boosting domestic aerospace capacity.\n- The five-year contract covers advanced machining, precision welding, and non-destructive testing to meet civil aviation standards.\n- The deal supports India’s **Make-in-India** initiative and strengthens the supply chain for GE Aerospace and **Safran Aircraft Engines**.

items.title: Karnataka govt to set up ₹2,345 crore steel plant in Koppal
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- A ₹2,345 crore steel plant will be set up in *Koppal* with a capacity of *3,50,000 tonnes* per year and is expected to be operational by *2028*. 
- It is a *Sumitomo–Mukand Sumi* joint venture with the *Bajaj Group*. 
- The minister also flagged opportunities such as a biomass unit in Karnataka and talks with *JFE Shoji* and *Yaskawa* to revive the *NGEF* in Hubballi, boosting the state's advanced manufacturing footprint.

items.title: India to lead hydrogen innovation hub under NGHM
items.summary: - *Green hydrogen* lies at the heart of India's plan to become a global hub for innovation, manufacturing and deployment in hydrogen technologies under the National Green Hydrogen Mission. - The mission targets decarbonising hard-to-abate sectors, creating jobs, cutting imports, and keeping Indian industry globally competitive. - The two‑day conference showcased 200+ R&D projects and emphasized turning labs into launchpads for startups.

items.title: FMCG companies say unrest in Nepal hits production
items.summary:
- **Dabur** and **Britannia** say Nepal's unrest has disrupted production at their units, with Britannia temporarily halting operations and Dabur reporting partial impact as workers cannot reach the Birganj plant.
- **Safety** remains a priority as Dabur asks Kathmandu staff to work from home and advises sales teams to follow local curfews.
- Nepal accounts for under 3% of Dabur's consolidated sales, highlighting how regional instability can affect FMCG supply chains.

items.title: FMCG, IT and Autos top high-ROE sectors since GFC
items.summary:
- The report identifies *FMCG*, *IT*, *auto*, *oil & gas* and *consumer durables* as India's most *consistent high-ROE* sectors since the *GFC*.
- A core high-ROE cohort—*FMCG*, *IT*, *oil & gas*, and *consumer durables*—accounts for over a third of market cap and earns *ROEs ~50% higher* than the rest.
- DSP Mutual Fund notes *FMCG* average ROE of *35.5%*, and ROE around *45.4% since the GFC*, while *IT*, *auto components*, *oil & gas*, and *financial services* have been top performers since the GFC.

items.title: Centre to boost domestic rare earth magnets
items.summary:
- The government is preparing fiscal incentives to boost *domestic production* of *rare earth magnets* to reduce reliance on China due to supply disruptions. 
- A scheme will provide targeted capital and operational expenditure support and tariff relief to bridge cost gaps and ensure continuity of supply amid rising global restrictions. 
- Inter-ministerial consultations are underway for a ₹1,345-crore subsidy to back processing facilities converting rare earth oxides into magnets, with Indian Rare Earth Magnets Ltd as the sole repository of rare earths.

items.title: Semiconductor market to reach $1.03T by 2030 (PwC)
items.summary:
- PwC projects the global *semiconductor market* to grow from **$627B** in 2024 to **$1.03T** by 2030, a CAGR of **8.6%**.
- Demand across *AI*, automotive, healthcare and renewables is driving growth, led by *server and network chips* (~11.6% CAGR) and *automotive* (~10.7%).
- Geopolitics, export controls and material restrictions are stressing the supply chain, boosting focus on *domestic production*, *supply-chain resilience* and advanced packaging, especially in *Southeast Asia*.

items.title: Nextgen plans to raise up to ₹1,500 crore in 12 months
items.author: PTI
items.summary: *Nextgen plans to raise *₹1,000-₹1,500 crore* in the next 12 months via equity and structured instruments to fund a Gujarat chip facility.* *The company will invest over *₹8,800 crore* in phases to build a fully integrated Silicon and Silicon Carbide platform in Dholera, with land allocated and ISM review underway.* *A wafer‑to‑power ecosystem and a tie‑up with Hitachi Energy aim to boost India’s self‑reliance in EVs, data centres and industrial electronics.*

items.title: RRP Electronics wins 100 acres for Navi Mumbai chip fab
items.summary: - **RRP Electronics** secured 100 acres in *Navi Mumbai* for a ₹12,000-crore semiconductor fab relocation from Sherman, Texas. - The LOA was presented by *Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis*, with construction to start within six months and first phase due by Q2 2026, targeting 125,000 wafers per month. - Backed by Sachin Tendulkar, the project advances India’s self-reliant semiconductor push and Maharashtra’s Semiconductor Mission roadmap.

items.title: NHRC directs timely distribution of fertilisers, no cane-charge on farmers
BSPGCL signs power supply agreement with Adani Power for Bhagalpur's Pirpainti thermal power plant
Share of natural gas in India's energy mix will double to 15% by 2030: Minister
Pralhad Joshi urges sugar mills to boost ethanol output
items.summary: - Union Food Minister *Pralhad Joshi* urged sugar mills to step up *ethanol production*, with the government eyeing exports.\n- Ethanol blending with petrol rose from 1.5% in 2014 to 20% this year, saving about ₹1.44 lakh crore in foreign exchange; the *biofuel policy* has helped mills diversify and pay farmers promptly.\n- ISMA projects 34.9 million tonnes of gross sugar for 2025–26, with 4.5–5 million tonnes diverted to ethanol and a plan to export up to 2 million tonnes of sugar.

items.title: Avio raises 400m euros to boost production
items.summary:
- Avio's 400-million-euro capital raise will expand production capacity in Italy and the United States, aligned with a 10-year plan targeting ~*10%* revenue growth and ~*15%* core profit rise.
- In space, Avio will boost the Vega-C launch cadence, advance the Vega E platform, and continue supplying propellants for Ariane rockets, while the defence arm builds a US facility due by 2028.
- The capital raise is slated to close by year-end in one or more tranches, backed by a pre-underwriting agreement with *Jefferies* and *Morgan Stanley*.

items.title: Boeing falling behind on certifying its 777X, CEO says
items.summary:
- Boeing is behind on certifying the *777-9 (777X)*, with first delivery now expected in 2026 and a “mountain of work” still to complete.
- Even a small schedule slip has a big financial impact, as the company has spent billions on the program while inflationary pressure affects pricing; it still aims to raise the *737 MAX* rate to 42/mo by year-end, once readiness is ensured.
- Debt reduction remains a top priority, and Boeing plans to accelerate the *787* production ramp toward ~10/mo next year after lifting to 7 and planning 8; political pressure to secure large orders also features in the context.

items.title: France deploys Rafale jets to Poland after drone incursions
items.summary:
- **France** deploys three *Rafale* jets to *Poland* to bolster **NATO's Eastern Flank** after Russian drone incursions.
- Macron announced the move to Polish PM *Donald Tusk* and spoke with *NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg* and UK PM *Keir Starmer* to defend Europe against Russian intimidation.
- Poland invoked *NATO Article 4*, signaling greater unity and marking one of France's most direct contributions to Eastern European air defence since 2022.

items.title: Bharat Forge, Windracers sign MoU to expand UAV ops in India
items.summary:
- *Bharat Forge* (BFL) and UK-based *Windracers* signed a two-year MoU to localise and trial the *ULTRA* UAV in India, enabling defence and civil deployments, including Navy carrier-delivery and tri-service logistics. 
- The pact aligns with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement and **Vision 2035**, boosting aerospace tech transfer and innovation. 
- *ULTRA* offers ~6–7 hours endurance with advanced mission control for operations in oceans, Himalayas, and Northeast India.

items.title: Denmark to buy $9B air defence systems amid Russia tensions
items.summary:
- Denmark plans to buy eight European-made air defence systems, including the *SAMP/T platform*, for about 58 billion Danish crowns.
- The purchase aims to strengthen *NATO* defenses amid the security situation and **Russian aggression in Europe**.
- The European systems can be delivered faster and cheaper than the US **Patriot** missile system.

items.title: Ant Group debuts humanoid robot with 'super-smart brain'
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- Ant Group unveiled the *R1* humanoid (Robbyant) at Shanghai's Bund conference, aiming it for roles like tour guiding and kitchen tasks.
- The firm says the robot's **brains**, powered by *cloud-based AI* and its BaiLing model, enable multi-step planning even as Bloomberg has not independently verified the claims.
- The R1 is being trialled in community care centres and restaurants with Ti5 Robot and Galaxea AI, with future healthcare/domestic plans and no price yet.
